title: Edward Snowden, Glenn Greenwald & Noam Chomsky -  A Conversation on Privacy
description:
11:00 to skip Intro.

The balance between national security and government intrusion on the rights of private citizens will be the topic of a panel discussion featuring renowned linguist and MIT professor Noam Chomsky, NSA whistleblower Edward Snowden, and Intercept co-founding editor Glenn Greenwald. Nuala Oâ€™Connor, president and CEO of the Center for Democracy and Technology, will act as moderator.

Chomsky and Greenwald will appear in person at the event, hosted in Tucson by the University of Arizona College of Behavioral Sciences, while Snowden will appear via videoconference.

Source: https://theintercept.com/a-conversation-about-privacy/
